introduction: Vor Biopharma, a clinical-stage company, raised $55.6 million to support its AML treatments and extend its cash runway until 2025, but faces challenges in securing funding for pivotal trials and has negative EPS forecasts.

statement: Evaxion Biotech announced a change in the ratio of its American Depositary Shares (ADSs) to ordinary shares, effective January 13, 2025. The current one ADS represents ten ordinary shares, which will change to one ADS representing fifty ordinary shares. This change is expected to enhance liquidity and is expected to be effective on or about January 13, 2025. The ADSs will continue to be traded on the Nasdaq Capital Market under the ticker symbol "EVAX", with no fractional new ADSs being issued in connection with the change.
introduction: Evaxion Biotech is changing its American Depositary Shares (ADSs) ratio, with one ADS representing 50 ordinary shares instead of 10, effective January 13, 2025, aiming to enhance liquidity.

statement: Karyopharm Therapeutics Inc. (KPTI) has been experiencing a decline in its stock price, reaching a 52-week low of $0.59. introduction: Karyopharm Therapeutics Inc. is experiencing a decline in its stock price, despite recent positive news, due to market challenges and insider selling.

statement: UnitedHealth Group Inc. and Amedisys Inc. have extended the deadline to complete their $3.3 billion merger to next year, following a lawsuit by the US Department of Justice and three states aiming to block the deal. The extension comes after the companies waived termination rights and agreed to a regulatory break fee of $275 million, which may increase to $325 million if specific conditions are not met. The merger, which was initially announced in 2022, has faced opposition from the government and states citing antitrust concerns, but the companies are pushing forward with the deal.
introduction: UnitedHealth Group and Amedisys have extended their $3.3 billion merger deadline to next year, after waiving termination rights and agreeing to a regulatory break fee, despite facing opposition from the US Department of Justice and three states over antitrust concerns.
